metadata.feature_description: Provides drag-and-drop column resizing functionality in edit mode for visual layout adjustments.

steps.action: Navigate to page with Content Layout module in edit mode
steps.expected: Content Layout module visible with column borders and resize handles
steps.actual: Content Layout module displayed with dashed column borders and circular resize handles visible

steps.action: Drag resize handle 100px to the right on 2-column layout
steps.expected: Left column should expand, right column should shrink
steps.actual: Left column changed from 479px (50%) to 584px (61%), right column changed from 479px (50%) to 374px (39%)

steps.action: Drag resize handle far to the left to minimize left column
steps.expected: Left column should not go below minimum width (105px as defined in code)
steps.actual: Left column stopped at 125px (13%), respecting the minimum width constraint

steps.action: Drag resize handle far to the right to maximize left column
steps.expected: Right column should not go below minimum width (105px)
steps.actual: Right column went to 86px (9%), which is BELOW the expected minimum of 105px. Left column expanded to 872px (91%)

issues: Maximum width constraint does not properly enforce minimum width on the adjacent column. The right column was allowed to shrink to 86px, below the configured minimum of 105px.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resize updates persist after save

steps.action: After resizing columns, reload the page
steps.expected: Column widths should persist after page reload
steps.actual: Column widths persisted: 2-column layout (91%, 9%) and 4-column layout (33%, 26%, 16%, 25%) maintained their sizes after reload. The resize API automatically saves changes via UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes endpoint.

steps.expected: 4-column layout visible with 3 resize handles between columns
steps.actual: 4-column layout displayed with panes showing 33%, 17%, 25%, 25% widths and 3 resize handles

steps.action: Drag middle resize handle (between columns 2 and 3) 80px to the right
steps.expected: Column 2 should expand, column 3 should shrink
steps.actual: Column 2 changed from 17% to 26%, Column 3 changed from 25% to 16%. Resize works correctly with multiple columns.

steps.action: Hover over resize handle between columns
steps.expected: Size viewer should appear showing percentage width of each column
steps.actual: Size viewer appeared showing '50%' for both columns in dark overlay badges. The UI feedback provides real-time percentage display during resize operations.

observations: The resize functionality uses jQuery UI resizable plugin with handles on the east (right) edge of each column.
Minimum column width is configured as 105px (colMinWidth in code), but the maximum width constraint has a bug that allows adjacent columns to shrink below this minimum.
Size viewer displays percentage widths in dark semi-transparent badges centered in each column during resize operations.
Resize changes are automatically saved via API call to UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes endpoint when mouse is released, without requiring explicit Publish action.
A publish conflict error appeared during testing ('Another user has taken action on the page'), which is expected behavior when page state changes during the session.
The resize handles are styled as small circular buttons (12x12px) positioned at the border between columns.
